newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures close higher across board.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures close higher across board.

text.p: Rubber futures closed higher across the board in moderate trade on some late local buying interest, brokers said on Thursday.

Prices in Tokyo and Kobe were mostly lower on sporadic profit-taking reflecting the yen's firmer tendency against the dollar but there was no follow-through selling interest here. "The market was untraded in the morning due to lack of fresh incentives but some late local shortcovering interest emerged in the afternoon to push local prices up slightly," a local rubber trader said.
At around 0945 GMT, April/June RSS3 rose half a cent to 130.75 U.S. cents a kg.
January RSS1 rose 1.25 cents to 176.50 Singapore cents (US$1.26) a kg.
January TSR20 rose half a cent to 172.00 Singapore cents (US$1.22) a kg.
